lines.content: This is a project template for a greenfield Java project. It's named after the Java mascot _Duke_. Given below are instructions on how to use it.
Prerequisites: JDK 17, update Intellij to the most recent version.
1. Open Intellij (if you are not in the welcome screen, click `File` > `Close Project` to close the existing project first)
1. Open the project into Intellij as follows:
1. Select the project directory, and click `OK`.
1. If there are any further prompts, accept the defaults.
1. Configure the project to use **JDK 17** (not other versions) as explained in [here](https://www.jetbrains.com/help/idea/sdk.html#set-up-jdk).
In the same dialog, set the **Project language level** field to the `SDK default` option.

1. After that, locate the `src/main/java/Joules.java` file, right-click it, and choose `Run Joules.main()` (if the code editor is showing compile errors, try restarting the IDE). If the setup is correct, you should see something like the below as the output:

**Warning:** Keep the `src\main\java` folder as the root folder for Java files (i.e., don't rename those folders or move Java files to another folder outside of this folder path), as this is the default location some tools (e.g., Gradle) expect to find Java files.

* Entry point for the Joules chatbot application.
* This class contains the {@code main} method that starts the chatbot,
* initializes stored tasks, and continuously processes user commands
* until the user exits with the {@code bye} command.
/** User interface for interacting with the chatbot */
private static final Ui UI = new Ui();
/** List of tasks representing the user's task history */
private static final TaskList tasks = new TaskList(DEFAULT_CAPACITY);
* This method processes commands such as {@code todo},
* The loop continues until the {@code bye} command is received.
throw new JoulesException(" Sorry, I do not understand ;<");
* Represents an exception specific to the Joules application.
* This exception is thrown when an error occurs during the execution
* of a Joules command or operation that cannot be handled normally.
* Parses user input commands in the Joules chatbot.
* Provides static methods to extract task numbers, descriptions, deadlines,
* and event dates from user input strings.
* Parses a "find" command to extract the keyword to search for.
* @param input The full user input starting with "find".
* @return The keyword to search for, trimmed of leading/trailing spaces.
* @throws JoulesException If no keyword is provided after "find".
public static String parseFind(String input) throws JoulesException {
throw new JoulesException(" Please add a keyword about what task you want to find!");
* Parses the task number from a user input command.
* @param input The full user input string (e.g., "mark 2").
* @param tasks The current list of tasks.
* @throws JoulesException If the input is not a valid integer or
*                         if the task number is out of range.
public static int parseTaskNum(String input, TaskList tasks) throws JoulesException {
throw new JoulesException(" There are only " + tasks.taskCount() + " tasks!");
throw new JoulesException(" Please enter a valid task number!");
* Parses the description of a todo task from a user input command.
* @param input The full user input string (e.g., "todo read book").
* @throws JoulesException If the description is missing or empty.
public static String parseTodo(String input) throws JoulesException {
throw new JoulesException(" Please add a description about what the todo is!");
* Parses the description and deadline date of a deadline task from a user input command.
* @param input The full user input string (e.g., "deadline submit report /by 2025-09-30").
* @return An array where the first element is the description and the second is the deadline date.
* @throws JoulesException If the description or date is missing or invalid.
public static String[] parseDeadline(String input) throws JoulesException {
throw new JoulesException(" Please add a description about what the deadline is!");
throw new JoulesException(" Please add a deadline with /by!");
throw new JoulesException(" Invalid date format or value, use yyyy-MM-dd ");
* Parses the description and start/end dates of an event task from a user input command.
* @param input The full user input string (e.g., "event meeting /from 2025-09-30 /to 2025-10-01").
* @return An array where the first element is the description,
*         the second is the start date, and the third is the end date.
* @throws JoulesException If the description or dates are missing or invalid.
public static String[] parseEvent(String input) throws JoulesException {
throw new JoulesException(" Please add a description about what the event is!");
throw new JoulesException(" Please ensure you have a /from and /to date!");
return new String[] { split[1].trim(), split[2].trim(), split[3] };
throw new JoulesException(" Invalid date format or value, use yyyy-MM-dd ");
* Handles persistent storage of tasks for the Joules chatbot.
* This class provides static methods to load tasks from a file,
* store individual tasks, and save all tasks to a file.
* Loads tasks from the storage file into the given {@link TaskList}.
* If the file does not exist, it will be created automatically.
* Each line in the file represents a task with the format:
* @param tasks The {@link TaskList} to populate with loaded tasks.
System.out.println("Unable to load unknown task type: " + line);
* Appends a single task string to the storage file.
* @param textToAppend The string representation of the task to append.
* Saves all tasks in the given {@link TaskList} to the storage file.
* This method overwrites the file contents and writes all tasks
* @param tasks The {@link TaskList} containing tasks to save.
* Handles user interactions for the Joules chatbot.
* This class provides methods to display welcome and goodbye messages,
* show task updates, read user input, and display errors.
/** Scanner to read input from the user */
private static final Scanner SCANNER = new Scanner(System.in);
* Displays the welcome message and ASCII art when the chatbot starts.
System.out.println(" What can I do for you?");
* Displays the goodbye message and ASCII art when the chatbot exits.
System.out.println(" Hope to see you again soon!");
* Reads a line of input from the user.
* @return The user's input as a {@link String}.
* Lists all tasks in the provided {@link TaskList}.
* @param tasks The {@link TaskList} containing tasks to display.
System.out.println(" You got this! These are your tasks:");
* Displays a message that the specified task has been marked as done.
* @param t The task that was marked.
System.out.println(" Keep up the good work! I've marked this task as done:");
* Prints all tasks from the given TaskList that contain the specified keyword
* @param keyword The string to search for in each task's description.
* @param tasks The TaskList containing the tasks to search through.
public void listMatchingTasks(String keyword, TaskList tasks) {
System.out.println(" I have found these matching tasks:");
* Displays a message that the specified task has been unmarked (not done).
* @param t The task that was unmarked.
System.out.println(" Okay, I've marked this task as not done yet:");
* Displays a message that the specified task has been deleted.
* @param t The task that was deleted.
System.out.println(" Okay, I've removed this task:");
* Displays a message that a task has been added and shows the
* @param t The task that was added.
* @param tasks The total number of tasks after adding this task.
public void addTask(Task t, int tasks) {
System.out.println(" You now have " + tasks + " task(s)");
* Displays an error message to the user.

* field for the due date. It can be stored and displayed with its
/** Due date of the deadline task */

* @param by The due date of the task.
* Returns a string representation of the deadline task,
* including its type, status, description, and formatted due date.

* An {@code Event} extends {@link Task} and includes {@link LocalDate}
* fields for the start and end dates. It can be stored and displayed
* Constructs an {@code Event} with the specified description, start date, and end date.

public Event(String description, LocalDate from, LocalDate to) {
* Returns a string representation of the event task,
* including its type, status, description, and formatted start and end dates.
* @return Formatted string of the event task.
* Stores the event task in the persistent storage.

* Represents a generic task with a description and completion status.
* A {@code Task} is the base class for all types of tasks (e.g., {@link Todo},
* {@link Deadline}, {@link Event}) and provides common functionality such
* as marking as done, unmarking, and returning a string representation.
/** Completion status of the task; true if done, false otherwise */
* Constructs a task with the specified description.
* The task is initially not done.
* @param description The description of the task.
* Returns the status icon representing whether the task is done.
* @return "X" if the task is done, otherwise a single space " ".
return (this.isDone ? "X" : " "); // mark done task with X
* Marks the task as not done.
* Returns a string representation of the task.
* The string includes the task's status (done or not) and description.
* Example format: "[X] Finish homework" or "[ ] Read book".
* @return String representing the task's status and description.
* Checks if the task description contains the given keyword, case-insensitive.
* @param keyword The keyword to search for in the description.
* @return true If the keyword appears in the description; false otherwise.
* Returns a string suitable for storage in the persistent file.
* The format includes completion status and description, separated by " | ".
* Example format: "1 | Finish homework" or "0 | Read book".
* @return String representing the task for storage.
* Stores the task in the persistent storage.
* Subclasses must implement this method to define how they are stored.
* Represents a list of tasks and provides methods to manipulate them.
* A {@code TaskList} stores tasks in an internal {@link ArrayList} and allows
* adding, removing, retrieving, counting, and printing tasks.
* Constructs a {@code TaskList} with an initial capacity.
* @param size the initial capacity of the task list.
* Adds a task to the task list.
* Removes a task from the task list at the specified position.
* @param num The 1-based index of the task to remove.
* Retrieves the task at the specified position in the task list.
* @param num The 1-based index of the task to retrieve.
* @return The {@link Task} at the specified position.
* Returns the number of tasks in the task list.
* Prints all tasks in the task list to the console.
* Each task is prefixed with its 1-based index.
* Prints all tasks in this TaskList whose descriptions contain the given keyword.
* Each matching task is numbered in order of appearance. If no tasks match,
* @param keyword The keyword to search for in task descriptions.
* Represents a todo task with a description and completion status.
* A {@code Todo} extends {@link Task} and does not have a date associated
* with it. It can be stored and displayed in a formatted way.
* Constructs a {@code Todo} with the specified description.
* @param description The description of the todo task.
* Returns a string representation of the todo task,
* including its type, status, and description.
* @return Formatted string of the todo task.
* Stores the todo task in the persistent storage.
* The task is stored in the format:
Deadline deadline = new Deadline("watch lecture", LocalDate.parse("2025-08-30"));
assertEquals(" ", task.getStatusIcon(), "New task should not be marked done");
assertEquals("X", task.getStatusIcon(), "Task should be marked as done");
